p:
Primary metabolites (e.g. amino acids, sugars and organic acids) and secondary metabolites (e.g. phenols, flavonoids and sterols) are components of the complex networks of biochemical pathways in plant metabolism
34 . Profiling their relative concentrations in samples provides information directly related to plant biological behaviour in response to changes in physiological or environmental conditions e.g. availability of important mineral nutrients such as nitrogen
35, 36 and phosphorus
37 , or to differences in composition between tissues e.g. the shoot and root terpenoid profiles of Tanacetum vulgare
38 .
